      Modifier and Type Method Description
      long getAllocatedBytes()
      Returns the number of bytes currently consumed by the serialized map

      Return the block size for the stored entries.

      Return the age that a block is incubated.
      long getMaxAllocatedMemory()
      Return the maximum number of bytes that this map should be permitted to allocate.
      default long getMaxBlockAge​(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Return the current maximum age for entries in the map before they are "forgotten".
      boolean removeEntry​(K key)
      Removes an entry from the map, similarly to Map.remove(Object), except returning a boolean to indicate success without deserialization of the previously stored value.
      default SerializedMap<K,​V> setBlockSize​(int blockSize)
      Set the block size for the map.
      default SerializedMap<K,​V> setIncubationAge​(long time, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Set the age at which no further new objects are appended to a new block.
      default SerializedMap<K,​V> setMaxAllocatedMemory​(long memory)
      Set the maximum amount of bytes to be consumed by the map before blocks are forgotten.
      default SerializedMap<K,​V> setMaxBlockAge​(long time, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Set the maximum age of a block before it may be forgotten.

      • setIncubationAge

        @Nonnull
default SerializedMap<K,​V> setIncubationAge​(long time,
                                                  @Nonnull
                                                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Set the age at which no further new objects are appended to a new block. A block leaves incubation after this time has elapsed or it is too full to accept further objects.
        Parameters:
        time - Time in units
        unit - Unit of time
        Returns:
        this map

      • removeEntry

        boolean removeEntry​(K key)
        Removes an entry from the map, similarly to Map.remove(Object), except returning a boolean to indicate success without deserialization of the previously stored value.
        Parameters:
        key - Key of entry to be removed from map
        Returns:
        true if an entry was successfully removed
